column4: i can only get my wireless connection working if i set my windows laptop to the same mac address and connect with the windows laptop...once i do that my linux wireless connection works
what is windows doing that ubuntu's not?
/etc/dhclient has the config for your dhcp client AFAIK
what kind of network connection do you have?
is there a reason you aren't using DHCP on the linux box?
is you windows boxes using static ip?
I'd guess that the router may not be configure to route from unrecognized mac addresses?
in which case you'll need to use DHCP from the linux box
I know, but the windows box is getting an IP lease for that mac address from the DHCP server
so until the lease expires the linux box can then route
You should be able to config the router to always lease the same IP to your linux box
which would essentially give you a static ip
Well, my best suggestion would be to use dhcp, and in /etc/dhcp3/dhclient.conf uncomment the send host-name and put your linux boxes host name
